verses.text: 父母與兒女你們作兒女的，要在主裡聽從父母，因為這是理所當然的。
「要孝敬父母，使你得福，在世長壽。」這是第一條帶著應許的誡命。

words.note: Lit. 'obtain blessing'

verses.text: 你們作父親的，不要激怒兒女，卻要照著主的教訓和勸戒，養育他們。
主人和僕人你們作僕人的，要存著敬畏、戰兢和真誠的心，聽從世上的主人，好像聽從基督一樣。
作事不要只作給人看，像那些討人歡心的一樣，卻要像基督的僕人，從心裡遵行　神的旨意，

words.note: Lit. 'seek people's joyful heart'

verses.text: 甘心服務，像是服事主，不是服事人。

words.note: Common in biblical context; 服務 is more general service.
Refers to God or Jesus in biblical context.

verses.text: 你們知道，無論是奴僕或自由的人，如果作了甚麼善事，都必從主那裡得到賞賜。

words.note: Common in ancient contexts and biblical texts.
More formal/biblical than 獎賞 (jiǎngshǎng).

verses.text: 你們作主人的，也要照樣對待奴僕，不要威嚇他們；你們知道，他們和你們在天上同有一位主，他並不偏待人。

words.note: Primarily used in religious or formal contexts.

verses.text: 穿戴　神所賜的軍裝最後，你們要靠主的大能大力，在他裡面剛強。

words.note: Indicates the following verb is acted upon by the preceding subject.
More formal than 給 (gěi).

words.definition: to rely on, to lean on

words.note: Often paired with 大力 in biblical contexts.
Often paired with 大能 in biblical contexts.
More formal or spiritual connotation than 堅強 (jiānqiáng).

verses.text: 要穿戴　神所賜的全副軍裝，使你們能抵擋魔鬼的詭計。

words.note: Indicates the following verb is acted upon by the preceding subject.

verses.text: 因為我們的爭戰，對抗的不是有血有肉的人，而是執政的、掌權的、管轄這黑暗世界的和天上的邪靈。

words.note: Often used in biblical context for spiritual warfare.
Idiomatic expression meaning human beings.
Refers to spiritual powers/authorities.
Refers to spiritual powers/authorities.

verses.text: 所以要穿起　神所賜的全副軍裝，使你們在這邪惡的時代裡可以抵擋得住，並且在作完了一切之後，還能站立得穩。

words.note: Refers to the divine being.
Often used for divine bestowal.
Location suffix, often following nouns or pronouns.
Verb complement indicating successful completion or ability to hold firm.
Verb complement indicating ability to stand firmly and steadily.

verses.text: 因此，你們要站穩，用真理當帶子束腰，披上公義的胸甲，

words.note: Verb-complement structure meaning to stand steadily or firmly.
Figurative phrase meaning to prepare for action or work.

verses.text: 把和平的福音預備好了，當作鞋子，穿在腳上，

words.note: Lit. 'blessed news'.
Functions as a resultative complement here.

verses.text: 拿起信心的盾牌，用來撲滅那惡者所有的火箭；

words.note: In biblical context, translates 'fiery darts' from Greek. Modern usage is 'rocket'.

verses.text: 並且要戴上救恩的頭盔，拿起聖靈的寶劍，就是　神的道，

words.note: Refers to deliverance and God's grace.
Literally 'precious sword'.
The space (　) is an honorific used in some Chinese Bibles.
Often refers to God's word or teaching.

verses.text: 藉著各樣的禱告和祈求，隨時在聖靈裡祈禱，並且要在這事上恆久警醒，為眾聖徒祈求。

words.note: Indicates scope or aspect.
A common biblical exhortation for spiritual vigilance.
Refers to believers, literally 'holy followers'.

verses.text: 也要為我祈求，使我傳講的時候，得著當說的話，可以坦然無懼地講明福音的奧祕，

words.note: Turns preceding phrase into a noun clause 'the time of my preaching'.
Forms 'that which should be said'.
Literally 'blessed news'.

verses.text: （我為這奧祕作了被捆鎖的使者），也使我按著應當說的，放膽宣講這福音的奧祕。

words.note: Forms 'that which should be said'.
Literally 'blessed news'.

verses.text: 祝福親愛的推基古弟兄是主裡忠心的僕人，他會把我的一切都告訴你們，使你們可以知道我的景況。

words.note: Used to prepose the object of a verb.

verses.text: 為了這緣故，我就差他到你們那裡去，好讓你們明白我們的近況，並且叫他安慰你們的心。

words.note: Often used with '為了' (wèi le).
Indicates a consequence or immediate action.
More formal than '送' (sòng).
Used to indicate causing an action.

verses.text: 願平安、慈愛、信心，從父　神和主耶穌基督臨到眾弟兄。

words.note: Often used to express a prayer or wish.
A key biblical term for God's steadfast love.
A core theological concept in Christianity.
Refers to God the Father in biblical context.
A respectful title for God or Jesus.
More formal than '來到' (láidào) or '到' (dào).
Used to indicate a group or collective.
Used in the church for male believers.

verses.text: 願一切以不朽的愛愛我們主耶穌基督的人，都蒙恩惠。

words.note: Formal way to express 'using' or 'with'.
A key theological concept, especially concerning eternal life.
Transforms the preceding phrase into an adjective modifying '人'.
Often used with abstract nouns like '恩惠' (ēnhuì).
A central biblical concept describing God's unmerited favor.
